transcription.text:
Speaker 1: Hey, Bud, Joe, as a veteran, I take a lot of pride and honor in my work, so let me give

Speaker 2: you my extension as a reference if you need anything at all, you can let me know.

Speaker 1: My extension is 0037, and then last name is Goodrich, Matera, so Bravo 18, man, 18 Bravo.

Speaker 2: So here, check this out.

Speaker 1: I did three things for you, Bud, to put you on a right path, and so the first thing I

Speaker 2: did is exactly what you wanted.

Speaker 1: The first thing I did is I put a stop to any and all monthly refills.

Speaker 2: The second thing I did is I overrided the system and I put a stop to any and all monthly

Speaker 1: shipments and charges.

Speaker 2: And the third thing I did is I canceled this doctor and I set you up with a different one

Speaker 1: because what I've noticed is if they didn't work, she wrote you the wrong script and I'm

Speaker 2: going to bill this guy and I'm going to send you a replacement for free, but you're not

Speaker 1: going to eat any of the fees because you're already paid, and if you didn't get the damn

Speaker 2: thing that worked, I'm going to send you a free replacement and these things should work

Speaker 1: because if they don't work, I'll let him, he's going to eat the bill.

Speaker 2: So I'm going to send you 20 pills, a pill for pill, to make you whole, Bud, because

Speaker 1: if you didn't get the right thing, that just really, that grinds my gears, Bud, so.

Speaker 2: Is there any way of refunding that $63.95 that was charged to me?

Speaker 1: I didn't authorize that.

Speaker 2: So yeah, so what we can do is, this is what we can do, Bud, to make things easier.

Speaker 1: You see this last batch that got sent to you on the 23rd and it probably, let me see when

Speaker 2: it got landed.

Speaker 1: No, it's, okay, so this is what we're going to do.

Speaker 2: This is the play we're going to run.

Speaker 1: I'm going to start the credit process for this refund, but you have a batch that's trying

Speaker 2: to be delivered to you right now.

Speaker 1: It's already in process.

Speaker 2: It says processing at destination and I'll show you how to track that, okay, but it comes

Speaker 1: to you on Thursday at 9 p.m. because of the weather, usually it takes faster.

Speaker 2: So when you get this, Joe, take the damn package, don't open it up, circle the address on the

Speaker 1: top left corner and write refuse, return to sender.

Speaker 2: You don't have to pay for anything.

Speaker 1: We have a tracking number on it and just put it in a blue USPS bin, you know, in those

Speaker 2: boxes.

Speaker 1: It'll come back to us as I'm starting this refund process for January.

Speaker 2: By the time it gets to us, by Monday or Tuesday, I'll have the pharmacy release the funds.

Speaker 1: They just need to verify that they got it and we have a tracking number.

Speaker 2: I'm driving and I don't have a pen with me, can you send me your contract information?

Speaker 1: Yeah, I can do that, but just remember, 0037, so when you call the same number, just dial

Speaker 2: 0037.

Speaker 1: If you can't get me and you get someone else, just tell them, hey, this is Joe, he's working

Speaker 2: with me, just let him know I called and I will call you back within that hour or that

Speaker 1: day.

Speaker 2: But let me just recap what I'm doing.

Speaker 1: The first thing I did is I put a stop to any and all monthly shipments, charges, and refills,

Speaker 2: and I paused your prescription and I'm starting back the credit process for this batch of

Speaker 1: January.

Speaker 2: Now, the December batch, I'm not authorized to do a credit, I mean, there is no credit

Speaker 1: for that, but I can send a replacement.

Speaker 2: But I'm going to send a replacement for those that is something that will work, it's an

Speaker 1: AGV, it's going to look the same, but I'm going to bill the doctor so he can eat that,

Speaker 2: you know?

Speaker 1: See, that's what I thought I was getting, I thought I was getting the AGV is what I

Speaker 2: was trying.

Speaker 1: No, so when I looked at your script, it says 50 milligrams, but it doesn't say AGV 50 milligrams.

Speaker 2: So this is what you're going to do.

Speaker 1: When you get the pills, don't read the bottle, when you open up, don't get the packages confused

Speaker 2: because this one's coming the next wave.

Speaker 1: This will be back to you like next week, Thursday.

Speaker 2: So when you pull out the pill, Joe, it'll say 50 on them.

Speaker 1: That's the golden age.

Speaker 2: Okay?

Speaker 1: That's how you decipher that.

Speaker 2: So I'm going to send you 10 of those, then we'll get you the refund for the other ones.

Speaker 1: All right, bud?

Speaker 2: Okay.

Speaker 1: But I won't be getting billed for anything else?

Speaker 2: No, no, no, we're going to run, this is a Hail Mary, let's see if it works, don't worry

Speaker 1: about any charges.

Speaker 2: Okay.

Speaker 1: Because your money's no good unless we can, you know, get something that actually works,

Speaker 2: bud, because otherwise, what the hell, just go somewhere else.

Speaker 1: But let's make you whole, let's get that money back.

Speaker 2: I'll get you 10 for the December batch.

Speaker 1: And then in the future, when you do get home, right, or wherever you're at, go to scoreblue.com

Speaker 2: on your browser, log in with your Yahoo account.

Speaker 1: When you log into your Yahoo account, you're going to see a category that says your prescription.

Speaker 2: There's going to be a tracking number on there, in that area, you can click and follow

Speaker 1: it.

Speaker 2: The other thing I'm doing is I'm putting a red button, so in the future, like in a month

Speaker 1: or two, you give me the green light of the stuff I'm sending you, you don't need to get

Speaker 2: blindsided, you just click that damn button and you get it whenever you want.

Speaker 1: I mean, even if you're traveling from Florida to Vegas, you can just update the address,

Speaker 2: right?

Speaker 1: But let's cross this first bridge, and then just remember, 0037, 0037 Goodrich.

Speaker 2: All right, bud?

Speaker 1: Sorry about that snafu, but I'll make it right.

Speaker 2: Thank you very much.

Speaker 1: I appreciate it.

Speaker 2: Yeah, you're very welcome.

Speaker 1: But no worries.

Speaker 2: Call me back next week, and then we'll get this thing going, all right, bud?

Speaker 1: Adios.

Speaker 2: Okay, very good.

Speaker 1: Thank you.
